com.samsung.android.sdk.pen.pen

Class SpenPen

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.samsung.android.sdk.pen.pen.SpenPen

  • public class SpenPen
extends Object
    Pen class This class provides the methods that control Pen. To use this class, create an instance using PenManager.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  SpenPen.ChangedListener
      This listener interface provides callback methods for advanced setting attribute change event.

    • Method Detail

      • draw

        public void draw(MotionEvent event,
        RectF rect)
        Called to process the following events: ACTION_DOWN, ACTION_MOVE and ACTION_UP
        Parameters:
        event - The event information. The valid values are: ACTION_DOWN ACTION_MOVE ACTION_UP
        rect - The output value of the internal rectangle that Pen draws.

      • redrawPen

        public void redrawPen(MotionEvent event,
             RectF rect)
        Redraw a stroke.
        Parameters:
        event - The event information. The valid values are: ACTION_DOWN ACTION_MOVE ACTION_UP The event's getX,getY is the last point and the historical point 0 becomes the first point and the rest become in-between points.
        rect - The output value of the internal rectangle that Pen draws.

      • setBitmap

        public void setBitmap(Bitmap bitmap)
        Set the specified bitmap for Pen. If the following methods are called before the bitmap is set, an exception is thrown. #draw
        Parameters:
        bitmap - Bitmap for Pen. For example: Bitmap bitmap = Bitmap.createBitmap(300, 300, Config.ARGB_8888); pen.setBitmap(bitmap);

      • getBitmap

        public Bitmap getBitmap()
        Get the pen bitmap.
        Returns:
        The bitmap for Pen. This method returns null, if no bitmap is set.

      • setReferenceBitmap

        public void setReferenceBitmap(Bitmap bitmap)
        Set the reference bitmap for Pen. Example: The background bitmap.
        Parameters:
        The - reference bitmap.

      • setSize

        public void setSize(float size)
        Set the specified Pen stroke size. If a negative value is set or Pen does not support the size option, an exception is thrown. Use getPenAttribute() to check if Pen supports the size option.
        Parameters:
        size - The Pen size.

      • getSize

        public float getSize()
        Get the Pen stroke size.
        Returns:
        size The Pen size.

      • getMinSettingValue

        public float getMinSettingValue()
        Get the minimum values for attributes on the SettingView.
        Returns:
        The minimum values for attributes on the SettingView.

      • getMaxSettingValue

        public float getMaxSettingValue()
        Get the maximum values for attributes on the SettingView.
        Returns:
        The maximum values for attributes on the SettingView.

      • setColor

        public void setColor(int color)
        Set the specified Pen color. If Pen does not support this option, an exception is thrown. Use getPenAttribute() to check if Pen supports the color option.
        Parameters:
        The - Pen color in ARGB8888 format.

      • getColor

        public int getColor()
        Get the Pen color.
        Returns:
        The Pen color in ARGB8888 format.

      • setCurveEnabled

        public void setCurveEnabled(boolean enable)
        Enable or disable curve drawing for Pen. If Pen does not support this option, an exception is thrown. Use getPenAttribute() to check if Pen supports the size option.
        Parameters:
        enable - Set to true to enable curves to be drawn with Pen, set to false to disable the drawing of curves with Pen. If it is set to false, Pen draws a straight line.

      • isCurveEnabled

        public boolean isCurveEnabled()
        Check if curve drawing is enabled for Pen.
        Returns:
        true - if curve drawing is enabled for Pen. false - if curve drawing is not enabled for Pen.

      • setAdvancedSetting

        public void setAdvancedSetting(String advancedSetting)
        Set the specified advanced setting for Pen. An individual attribute can be activated and set as a string. If Pen does not support this option, an exception is thrown. Use getPenAttribute() to check if Pen supports the advanced setting option.
        Parameters:
        The - Pen advanced setting.
        See Also:
        showAdvancedSetting, hideAdvancedSetting, SpenPen.ChangedListener

      • getAdvancedSetting

        public String getAdvancedSetting()
        Get the Pen advanced setting.
        Returns:
        The Pen advanced setting. This method returns null if Pen does not support advanced settings.
        See Also:
        showAdvancedSetting, hideAdvancedSetting, SpenPen.ChangedListener

      • showAdvancedSetting

        public void showAdvancedSetting(SpenPen.ChangedListener listener,
                       ViewGroup viewGroup)
        Show the current advanced settings or the view for the settings.
        Parameters:
        listener - The ChangedListener instance for receiving advanced settings change events.
        viewGroup - The parent view for the views created internally for advanced settings.
        See Also:
        setAdvancedSetting, getAdvancedSetting, SpenPen.ChangedListener

      • hideAdvancedSetting

        public void hideAdvancedSetting()
        Hide the advanced settings view
        See Also:
        setAdvancedSetting, getAdvancedSetting, SpenPen.ChangedListener

      • getPenAttribute

        public boolean getPenAttribute(int attribute)
        Check if Pen supports the specified attribute. Use this method to check if an attribute is supported before calling the set methods for the attribute.
        Parameters:
        The - Pen attribute. Example: getAttribute(pen.PEN_ATTRIBUTE_SIZE) The valid values are: PEN_ATTRIBUTE_SIZE PEN_ATTRIBUTE_ALPHA PEN_ATTRIBUTE_COLOR PEN_ATTRIBUTE_CURVE PEN_ATTRIBUTE_ADVANCED_SETTING For more information, see Field Detail in this class reference.
        Returns:
        true - if the specified attribute is supported. false - if the specified attribute is not supported.

      • getStrokeRect

        public RectF getStrokeRect(SpenObjectStroke stroke)
        Get the rectangle for the specified stroke.
        Parameters:
        stroke - The strike object with point, size, and color information. #SpenObjectStroke
        Returns:
        The calculated rectangle.
